movie: Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsallem
brief_introduction: 1.Civil marriage and civil divorce do not exist in Israel, and all marriages and divorces must be 'legal' by rabbinic decision, but the rights of the husband often override those of a third party. It is in this context that the story of 'The Lawsuit' is told. The main character, Vivian Amsalem, has proposed marriage since three years ago, but her husband, Eliza, does not agree. Even though Elisha is hard_headed and refuses to compromise, Viviane is determined to fight for her freedom, but the attitude of the religious ruler is ambiguous. In the course of the three_way tug_of_war, a scene of tragedy and absurdity continues to unfold.

comment_on.comment_on: A small court, a simple divorce proceeding, but round and round becomes a knot that can never be untied, this is the imbalance of gender relations in Jewish marriage, the unequal status of women led to women's rights are completely ignored, too oppressive.

A simple divorce proceeding lasted five years, and the confrontation in a single scene was very tense, and the long trial revealed the absurdity of the male_dominated social environment and the religious court system. The most rare thing is that the director did not set the female protagonist as a traditional underdog image, from the costume to the way she acts, she is rebellious, self_directed and self_acting is also worthy of recognition.

Minimal scenes, minimal plot, but tells a story with extremely rich connotations, religion, society, emotions, human nature, and more importantly, the status and fate of a woman in that kind of environment, captivating the audience. Surprise, anger, reflection, and a touch of celebration ......

brief_introduction: Carlos Galindo (Demián Bichir) is an undocumented man who has been smuggled into the United States from Mexico. His wife left him a long time ago and he now lives with his 14_year_old son Luis Galindo. His son suffers from discrimination and bullying at school because of his special status, but he is always silent about his father's inquiries, and the gap between them grows deeper and deeper. In order to make a better life for himself and his son, Carlos works hard to ping orders to earn money. One of his gardeners, his regular job is to mow lawns for all kinds of rich Americans. His boss is selling his used truck and essential tools for gardeners because he wants to return to his home country. Hoping to turn more money, Carlos borrowed money from his sister to buy the old truck and gardening tools that people had eliminated. But one day, Carlos's old truck is stolen by Santiago (Carlos Linares), a neighborhood punk. In the anxiety of the father and son for the first time honestly, restore the previous affection. Father and son embark on a journey together to find the truck ......

brief_introduction: The story begins in 1938, when the shadow of an impending war looms over every Jew. In order to take refuge, Walter (Merab Ninidze) takes his wife Jeta (Juliane Köhler) and daughter Regina (Lea Kurka) to the African continent, where they hope to escape the war and start a new life. At first, the harsh natural environment and the completely different way of life make Jeta feel very uncomfortable, and the relationship between the couple becomes precarious as she takes out all her anger and resentment on her husband. However, with the passage of time and a series of accidents, Jetta gradually got used to a life full of hard work but also full of happiness, but also know how to cherish the people in front of them. And the young Regina is more into the foreign culture, but also in the local made a lot of friends. The war ended, the family's stay became the biggest problem.

comment_on.comment_on: There are no superior white people, no stupid and pedantic Africans, and no arrogance and self_centeredness of the Western colonial culture, but rather a true representation of the helplessness of white Westerners in a foreign land and the simple and cheerful nature of Africans. brief_introduction: 11.In a teahouse in the Lahore bazaar, a Pakistani man chats to an American stranger about his story. Genghis, from a fallen Pakistani family, had worked hard to weave the American dream, and he did have the life many immigrants dream of: graduating from Princeton University, being recruited by a top financial advisory firm in Manhattan, falling in love with an elegant rich girl, and squeezing into New York's high society. He quietly thought that this was the life he was destined to lead. However, after the September 11 terrorist attacks, everything changed. The world around him, the woman he loves, his inner self identity, everything starts to fall apart, and things that he never noticed before, that were hidden in the deepest part of his heart, start to come out

brief_introduction: 12.Far from Anatolia in Istanbul, retired theater actor Aidan (Haluk Bilginer) has embarked on a new life as a columnist. He writes about religion day in and day out with a pretense of concern, absorbed in the seemingly profound world of thought he has created for himself. Aydin runs a hotel on his pension and has a number of properties for rent, which makes him seem hypocritical and cold in his contact with the general public. His sister Nika (Demet Akbag), divorced at an early age, often huddles in Aidan's study, arguing about his writing and even taunting each other. His wife Nihal (Melisa Sözen) is young and independent, with a passion for various charity work. The old couple, who live apart and have very different attitudes, drift apart and a rift appears in their relationship ......

comment_on.comment_on: Not as dull as expected, the lines still have a lot of content, plus the usual excellent photography in Ceylon. The choice of scenery on the unique, exterior scenes seem very spectacle.

The 3 hours and 16 minutes are set in the alien planet_like landscape of Cappadocia, with a large amount of dialogue rarely seen in Ceylonese cinema, to unravel the dilemma of human communication getting deeper and more distant. All the characters in the play have done nothing wrong, and are even good people in their own world, but there are always violent and incomprehensible conflicts brewing and erupting behind their contradictory interests and behavioral logic. Many times the virtue of humility and concessions will only make the other side in the quarrel as a provocation.

This is a pessimistic film to the core, the gap between different social classes can not be eliminated, dear between you and me but there is an impenetrable barrier, every attempt to communicate eventually become mutual harm. Only hibernation, perhaps the world can be returned to the quiet, or, in all walks of life, no longer use words, but simply listen to the communication of the heart. The conversation becomes a piece, but wonderful, class, human nature, through the painful chat or quarrel presented.
